Libyan Figure on Friendly Relations with DPRK 
   Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Libya and the DPRK, far away as they are from each other geographically, established friendly and cooperative relations in different fields and have developed them from long ago and Libya hopes that these relations will steadily grow in strength in the future, too, said Ahmed Mohamed Ibrahim, assistant general secretary of the General People's Congress of Libya, when receiving credentials from Kim Tong Je, DPRK ambassador to Libya, on June 7.
 He expressed the expectation that the Korean people would achieve great successes in their endeavors to reunify the country.

Kim Yong Nam Greets Putin
   Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to V.V. Putin, president of Russia, on the occasion of its national day.
 The message sincerely wished Putin good health and happiness as well as greater success in his responsible work for the social and economic development of the country and the wellbeing of the people.    
 It expressed the belief that the traditional bonds of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to expand in various fields in the basic interests of the two peoples in the future, too.
